natural solution: Subtracting $\frac{3x-3}{x-1}=3$ from both sides gives \[\frac{3x+2}{x-1}-\frac{3x-3}{x-1}=4-3\]so \[\frac{5}{x-1}=1.\]Cross-multiplying gives \[5=x-1,\]so \[x=\boxed{6}.\]
